abstract: China's central bank moves to cut interest rates and reduce reserves at certain banks following steep plunge in Shanghai and Shenzhen stock markets; moves signal government's desire to maintain stock rally that has been fueled by speculative trading and borrowed capital.
lead_paragraph: Action by the bank was viewed as a sign that the government is not eager to see an end to a rally that has more than doubled prices in the last 12 months.

headline.main: China Cuts Interest Rates After Market Plunge
headline.print_headline: China Cuts Interest Rates a Day After a Market Plunge

snippet: Action by the bank was viewed as a sign that the government is not eager to see an end to a rally that has more than doubled prices in the last 12 months.
